summary: This is an email from July 22, 2020, discussing internal deliberations among law enforcement officials regarding how to respond to requests from victims of Jeffrey Epstein for formal notification letters from the FBI. The letters are needed for victims to apply to a compensation fund, but there is concern because not all interviewed individuals may qualify as victims of a federal crime.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure whose crimes are the subject of the victim notification process. The document discusses identifying victims of his actions.

events.title: Internal Discussion on Victim Notification Letters
events.description: Law enforcement officials discuss via email how to handle requests from Epstein's victims for formal FBI notification letters to apply for a victim compensation fund.

keyFacts: Victims of Jeffrey Epstein were requesting formal notification letters from the FBI to assist in applying for a victim compensation fund.
The FBI was hesitant to provide generic letters stating the individuals were victims of a federal crime by Epstein, as not all interviewed 'girls' necessarily met that legal threshold.
The document reveals an internal policy dilemma within law enforcement about how to appropriately assist all individuals negatively affected by Epstein while adhering to legal definitions.
The correspondence is from the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, indicating an active, multi-agency investigation.
The email plans a follow-up phone call for the following week to finalize a response to the victims' representatives.
